rules: Rule1: If the manuscript for Compound X was published in the Scientific Journal, then it was accepted by the Scientific Journal.
Rule2: Under the condition that the methodology for Compound X is valid, its manuscript is published in the Scientific Journal.
Rule3: If the findings for Compound X are significant, then the research is not ethical.
Rule4: The fact that citations for Compound X have increased implies that its findings are significant.
Rule5: Either Dr. Smith is the senior author for Compound X or Student Lee is the junior author for Compound X.
Rule6: In case Student Lee is the junior author for Compound X, then, provided that funding for Compound X was not granted by the National Science Agency, Compound X was safety-tested.
Rule7: The data for Compound X being verified by the Lab Journal implies that its manuscript was submitted to the Lab Journal.

Rule8: Assuming Dr. Jones is the chief editor of the Scientific Journal, then if it is not the case that Dr. Smith being the senior author for Compound X implies that (if funding for Compound X was not granted by the National Science Agency, then Compound X was safety-tested), then authorship of Compound X is not disputed.
Rule9: Either Dr. Jones is the chief editor of the Scientific Journal or Professor Brown is the associate editor of the Scientific Journal.

Rule10: If the publisher approves the Scientific Journal, then, given that it is not the case that (if Professor Brown is the associate editor of the Scientific Journal, then (if it is not the case that Dr. Smith being the senior author for Compound X implies that (if funding for Compound X was not granted by the National Science Agency, then Compound X was safety-tested), then authorship of Compound X is not disputed)) implies legal action regarding Compound X and the Scientific Journal, a retraction for Compound X is not issued by the Scientific Journal.

Rule11: In the event that the publisher rejects the Scientific Journal, then, under the condition that it is not the case that (if Professor Brown is the associate editor of the Scientific Journal, then (if it is not the case that Dr. Smith being the senior author for Compound X implies that (if funding for Compound X was not granted by the National Science Agency, then Compound X was safety-tested), then authorship of Compound X is not disputed)) implies legal action regarding Compound X and the Scientific Journal, a retraction for Compound X is not issued by the Scientific Journal.
Rule12: Whenever the board of the Scientific Journal meets, a quorum is met for the Scientific Journal.
Rule13: Either the board of the Scientific Journal meets or the board of the Scientific Journal is absent.
Rule14: If the board of the Scientific Journal is absent, then the publisher rejects the Scientific Journal.
Rule15: A quorum being met for the Scientific Journal leads to the publisher approving the Scientific Journal.
Rule16: Compound X being safety-tested means it is not chemically stable.
Rule17: If it is not the case that (the findings for Compound X being reproducible implies its methodology is valid), then the co-authors agree on Compound X.

Rule18: Under the condition that it is not the case that Dr. Smith being the senior author for Compound X implies that (if funding for Compound X was not granted by the National Science Agency, then Compound X was safety-tested), authorship of Compound X is disputed.

Rule19: In case it is not the case that (Compound X being peer-reviewed in the Scientific Journal implies its data was verified by the Lab Journal), then Compound X was plagiarized in the Scientific Journal.
Rule20: The fact that it is not the case that (the lab results for Compound X being compiled implies Compound X was safety-tested) implies that the findings for Compound X are reproducible.

Rule21: Assuming it is not the case that (it is not the case that (the findings for Compound X being reproducible implies its methodology is valid) implies the co-authors do not agree on Compound X), then the research on Compound X is ethical.

Rule22: Provided that it is not the case that (it is not the case that (the findings for Compound X being reproducible implies its methodology is valid) implies the co-authors do not agree on Compound X), citations for Compound X have increased.

Rule23: If it is not the case that (it is not the case that (Professor Brown being the associate editor of the Scientific Journal implies that (if it is not the case that Dr. Smith being the senior author for Compound X implies that (if funding for Compound X was not granted by the National Science Agency, then Compound X was safety-tested), then authorship of Compound X is not disputed)) implies legal action regarding Compound X and the Scientific Journal), then a retraction for Compound X was issued by the Scientific Journal.

Rule24: Under the condition that it is not the case that (it is not the case that (the lab results for Compound X being compiled implies Compound X was safety-tested) implies the manuscript for Compound X was accepted by the Scientific Journal), there is a copyright issue with Compound X in the Scientific Journal.

Rule25: Provided that it is not the case that (it is not the case that (the lab results for Compound X being compiled implies Compound X was safety-tested) implies the manuscript for Compound X was accepted by the Scientific Journal), there is not a copyright issue with Compound X in the Scientific Journal.
Rule26: The fact that funding for Compound X was not granted by the National Science Agency implies that Compound X was peer-reviewed in the Scientific Journal.
Rule27: Assuming funding for Compound X was not granted by the National Science Agency, then Compound X is chemically stable.
Rule28: If funding for Compound X was not granted by the National Science Agency, then the lab results for Compound X were compiled.
facts: Fact1: The manuscript for Compound X was not submitted to the Lab Journal.
Fact2: Legal action was not taken regarding Compound X and the Scientific Journal.
Fact3: Compound X was not plagiarized in the Scientific Journal.
Fact4: The manuscript for Compound X was not accepted by the Scientific Journal.

question: Funding for Compound X was granted by the National Science Agency.
